publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: Of predestination [and] election made by Joh [a] n Lamberd minister of the church of Elham. Anno M.D.L
monogr.author: Lambert, John, minister of Elham

div.head: The Author.
div.p:
I Haue declared my iudgement which is but small, concernynge predestinacion and the foreknoweledge of God. Therfore gentle reader accepte my good wyll, and where as you se a faute in my buyldynge that frames not to youre mynde, accepte my meanyng I pray you, and cauyll not, for I am not obstynat, but wyllynge to knowe the truthe: And as nyghe as I canne Goddes lyuely worde shall be the foundacion wheron I entende to buylde at any tyme. Euery good gyfte, and euery perfyte gyfte, is from aboue, and commeth downe from the father of lyghte. Therfore let vs alwayes thynke that the goodnes that we haue or shall haue commeth of God and not of
our selues to whome be all honor, and glory.
div.closer:
AMEN
Geue the prayse to God.
Domine saluum fac regem.

q.l: Non mortui laudabunt te domine: neque
Sed nos qui viuimus benedicimus domino:
ex hoc nunc et vsque in seculum.
